name: Complete Smokehouse
steps: Select a level ground location away from dwelling
Build rectangular stone or brick foundation (6x8 ft)
Construct wooden frame walls using mortise and tenon joints
Create wooden barrel or box structure for main chamber
Install metal grate for smoking level
Build chimney extension using metal piping
Create door frame with tight seal (burlap-lined)
Build firebox extension below main chamber
Create air vents for smoke control
Season the smokehouse with cool smoke for 2 days
Test with practice meats before actual smoking
Create smoke control mechanism with dampers
Document temperature and smoke flow patterns
success: Maintains 180-225°F with steady smoke flow; meat cooks evenly without burning; no temperature fluctuations; smoke exits through top vent only

name: Survival Bow & Arrow Set
steps: Select appropriate yew wood stave free of knots
Split and season the wood for 4-6 weeks
Carve bow handle and grip section
Create recurved shape by careful carving
Taper the limbs from handle to tips
Craft bowstring from hemp or plant cordage
Make arrow shafts from straight wood
Attach arrow tips using sinew binding
Craft protective arm guard from leather
Test bow for consistent draw weight
Practice with 20 arrows at varying distances
Adjust for any curve or imbalance
success: Bow draws smoothly to 28-32 inches; arrows fly straight to 50+ yards; consistent grouping within 6 inches at 30 yards; no string breakage after 100 shots

name: Clay Oven & Bread Baking
steps: Mix clay and sand in 3:1 ratio with straw
Create molds for clay bricks and air-dry
Construct arched dome using clay and sand
Allow dome to cure for 2 weeks minimum
Build chimney pipe extending 3-4 feet up
Create metal door frame with seal
Season oven with low fires over 5 days
Create ash rake and peel tools
success: Reaches 800-900°F in 45 minutes; maintains temperature for 8+ loaves; bread bakes in 90-120 seconds with golden crust; even browning around entire oven

name: Tanned Leather Boots
steps: Prepare hide by removing hair and flesh
Soak hide in tanning solution for 2-3 weeks
Work in tanning solution daily by hand
Oil and stretch the leather while drying
Create boot lasts (wooden forms) to size
Cut leather patterns for uppers and soles
Stitch upper leather sections together using sinew
Attach sole using stitching and adhesive
success: Boots fit snugly with proper arch support; water-resistant coating lasts 3+ months; no cracking after 50 hours of wear; stitches hold under stress; comfortable for all-day hiking

name: Complete Herbal Medicine Kit
steps: Dry herbs in bundles or screens
Create clay storage pots with lids
Create herbal salves by infusing oil
Make herbal teas in muslin pouches
Label all remedies with date and use
Store kit in cool, dry place
success: Contains 12+ functional remedies; all herbs properly dried and stored; tinctures clear and properly labeled; remedies effective for common ailments within 2 weeks of use

name: Forge & First Knife
steps: Create anvil station from steel block or stone
Create sharp edge through continued hammering
Quench in oil to set hardness
Create wooden handle fitted to tang
Secure handle with pins or rivets
Test blade for hold and performance
success: Blade holds sharp edge for 50+ cuts through wood; no cracks after hardening; handle secure and ergonomic; blade straight with no warping; edge angle consistent at 20 degrees

name: Chicken Coop System
steps: Design coop for 6-12 birds with space requirements
Build wooden frame structure (8x10 ft recommended)
Create nesting boxes (12x12 x 12 deep each)
Add bedding material to boxes and floor
Install secure door with latch mechanism
Cover structure with metal roofing or shingles
Create outdoor run extension with netting
success: Holds 8-12 birds safely; predator-proof with no escapes; produces 6+ eggs daily; birds healthy and calm; easy to clean access; good ventilation without drafts

name: Water Purification Station
steps: Create stacked filtering system with containers
Create charcoal layer from burned wood
Add fine sand and cloth final layer
Create clay settling basin for initial water
Build protective cover to prevent recontamination
Test purified water clarity and taste
success: Removes visible particles completely; water runs clear; no smell or taste of contamination; filters 10+ gallons daily; color improvement visible immediately

name: Woven Clothing Set
steps: Dye spun yarn in natural dyes
Set up weaving loom with warp threads
Weave tight cloth for tunic base
Weave pants material at looser tension
Create belt fabric with decorative pattern
Hand-sew pieces together using needle and thread
Add seams with overlap and double stitch
Create neck opening with reinforced stitches
Add decorative trim or woven edging
Test fit and adjust as needed
success: Tunic fits comfortably without restriction; cloth feels durable and doesn't unravel; colors are vibrant and don't fade quickly; seams hold under strain; fully wearable outfit

name: Root Cellar
steps: Select location with good drainage and stability
Build log frame supports within chamber
Line walls with clay to seal
Install drainage sump at lowest point
Build entrance tunnel with insulating turns
Create sealed wood door at entrance
Add ventilation ducts for air circulation
Stock with root vegetables and preserved foods
success: Maintains 35-45°F year-round; humidity stays 85-95%; vegetables store for 3+ months without spoilage; no mold or rot visible; proper air circulation without drafts

name: Solar Dehydrator
steps: Build wooden frame box (3x4 ft base)
Install glass or clear plastic top
Create internal shelves with screen mesh
Add side vents for air circulation
Build chimney duct at top for exhaust
Arrange on mesh screens in dehydrator
Rotate trays every 8 hours for even drying
success: Maintains 125-145°F in sunlight; evaporates 2-4 lbs of water daily; jerky/fruit fully dried in 8-16 hours; no mold growth; preserved foods last 6+ months

name: Soap & Candle Workshop
steps: Collect and render animal fat for tallow
Create lye solution from wood ash and water
Stir mixture until it reaches trace
Cut soap into bars and store
Create candle molds from clay or containers
Pour melted tallow with wick secured
success: Soap bars are solid and hold shape; lather well with water; last 2+ weeks of daily use; candles burn evenly for 20+ hours; no smoke or unpleasant smell

name: Map & Navigation Kit
steps: Sketch local area map on paper
Create leather map case with closure
Fashion measuring scale tool from wood/metal
Prepare legend for symbols and features
success: Compass needle aligns true north consistently; map orientation is accurate; landmarks correctly positioned; kit is waterproof and portable; navigation using kit is accurate to 50ft

name: Community Trading Post
steps: Build frame and walls from lumber
Create shelving for multiple product types
success: Structure is weathertight; accommodates 20+ people simultaneously; transactions documented accurately; fair exchange rate system established; used by 80% of community

name: Complete Camp Kitchen
steps: Build fire pit with stone surround
Create tripod stand for cooking pots
Build wooden prep table at waist height
Create pot hooks and hanging system
Create water collection and storage area
Build cutting board and tool storage
Organize storage for utensils and spices
Set up dish washing and drying area
success: Meal preparation for 6+ people in under 2 hours; all tools accessible; fire remains safe and controlled; food cooked evenly; cleanup easy and efficient

name: Rope Bridge
steps: Install anchor points on both sides
Create main support cables from braided cordage
Anchor cables to rocks or metal stakes
Create walking surface with wood planks
Lash planks securely to support cables
Test structure with weight stress tests
Document load capacity and maintenance schedule

Test output in varying wind speeds

name: Waterwheel Power Station
steps: Survey stream for optimal head and flow rate
Build millrace channel to concentrate water
Attach paddle blades to wheel rim
Forge metal axle and bearing assemblies
Build support structure for wheel mounting
Install gearing system for speed control
Create belt drive mechanism to load
Connect to grinding or pumping station
Build tailrace for water return flow
Install flow control gate for regulation
Test operation under various water levels
success: Wheel turns consistently at 8-12 RPM; powers grinding or pumping; operates in low and high water; axle bearings last 6+ months; no structural failure

name: Biogas Digester
steps: Excavate pit for digester tank placement
Seal drum with airtight lid and gasket
Install inlet pipe for feedstock delivery
Attach gas collection bladder to top
Install gas valve and regulator assembly
Connect tubing to gas burner outlet
Load digester with manure and water mix
Seal system completely with no leaks
Monitor gas production daily with flow meter
Test gas flame quality and color
Build simple gas burner for testing
Create feeding schedule for continuous operation
Measure and record gas yields weekly
success: Produces combustible methane within 2 weeks; gas burns with blue flame; consistent daily output; no leaks detected; digestate usable as fertilizer

name: Solar Still (Water Distiller)
steps: Dig shallow pit 3ft wide and 2ft deep
Place dark basin at center bottom
Place collection cup in center of pit
Cover pit completely with clear plastic sheet
Seal all edges with soil and rocks
Place small stone at center for drip point
Ensure no air leaks in the seal
Allow sun to heat and evaporate water
Harvest distilled water daily from cup
Refill basin as needed with fresh water
Create multiple stills for higher output
success: Produces 1-2 quarts of clean water daily per still; water is clear and tasteless; no contamination in distilled output; operates unattended; works in partial sun

name: Battery Bank (Voltaic Pile)
steps: Cut copper discs to uniform size and thickness
Cut zinc discs to match copper disc dimensions
Prepare electrolyte solution from vinegar or brine
Soak cloth separators in electrolyte solution
Create 20+ cell stack for adequate voltage
Wire terminal connections in series configuration
Test voltage output with simple circuit
Connect multiple piles in series for higher voltage
Build storage rack for organized battery bank
Document voltage curves over discharge time
Test current output under various loads
success: Each pile produces 8-10V; bank powers small LED or telegraph; lasts 4+ hours per charge cycle; replaceable components; consistent voltage output

name: Pack Saddle & Harness Set
steps: Measure animal's back for frame dimensions
Carve two wooden saddle bars with proper curve
Create crosspiece connections with mortise joints
Pad bars with layered cloth for comfort
Cut leather panels for frame covering
Stitch leather securely over frame structure
Create girth strap with buckle and adjustment
Make breast collar for load stability
Build breeching strap for downhill control
Test fit on animal for proper positioning
Adjust padding and balance for even load distribution
success: Distributes 80-100 lbs evenly; no pressure sores after 8-hour use; animal moves freely; load stays balanced on hills; all straps secure

name: Wooden Cart & Wheels
steps: Design cart bed dimensions for intended load
Build flat cart bed from joined planks
Create wheel hubs from hardwood blocks
Bore center holes precisely for axle
Carve 8 spokes per wheel from straight wood
Create wheel rim segments and joints
Join rim pieces with wooden dowels
Heat and shrink iron tire band onto rim
Forge metal axle with proper dimensions
Install axle through cart frame assembly
Add side rails and tailgate for containment
success: Carries 500+ lbs on flat ground; wheels roll true without wobble; axle greased and smooth; cart pulled by single animal; survives rough terrain without breaking

name: Raft & Sail System
steps: Strip bark and dry logs thoroughly
Lay logs parallel and lash crossbeams securely
Step mast through deck with support structure
Build simple square sail from canvas
Create boom and gaff for sail control
Rig sail with halyard and sheet lines
Build steering oar and rudder mount
Create lee boards for improved tracking
Waterproof all lashings with natural sap
Test buoyancy with full intended load
success: Supports 800+ lbs safely; sails downwind and across wind; steerable with rudder; logs remain lashed after 8+ hours; sail holds in 15mph wind

name: Snowshoe & Winter Gear Set
steps: Select flexible ash or birch wood strips
Steam and bend strips into teardrop frame
Secure frame ends with strong lashing
Weave rawhide webbing in tight pattern
Build toe hole opening for foot insertion
Create leather binding straps for feet
Wax all wood surfaces for weather resistance
Create hand warmers from fur scraps
Build insulated face covering for protection
Test snowshoes in deep snow conditions
Adjust bindings for secure and comfortable fit
success: Supports body weight on 2ft+ snow; frame doesn't crack at -20°F; webbing holds for 50+ miles; bindings release easily; no frostbite with gear set

name: Travois (Drag Sled)
steps: Select two straight poles 10-12ft in length
Strip bark and smooth all pole surfaces
Space poles at shoulder width at narrow end
Attach crossbar supports at regular intervals
Create platform from canvas or hide
Attach platform to crossbars with lashing
Add side rails for load containment
Create pulling harness for person or animal
Pad harness contact points with cloth
Add tie-down straps for cargo securing
success: Carries 100-200 lbs depending on terrain; poles flex without breaking; platform stays taut; harness distributes pull evenly; works on snow, grass, and dirt

name: Log Cabin (Full Build)
steps: Notch first course of logs with saddle notch
Stack log walls with alternating overlap
Create roof sheathing from split logs
Add bark or shingle roofing layer
Finish floor with packed earth or puncheon logs
success: Weathertight in rain and snow; maintains 60°F+ with fire in winter; logs settled and stable; chimney draws properly; door and windows seal tight

Line walls with stone as you dig
Install drum roller with crank handle
Test water quality and flow rate

Mix clay soil and sand 1:1 ratio
Let set in molds for 24 hours
Remove from molds onto curing racks

Build sample wall section to test
Create production schedule for building project

Raise bent frames with community help

Build roof with sheathing and shingles
Build hay loft with ladder access
Install large barn doors on track

name: Suspension Footbridge
steps: Survey crossing point for span distance
Install anchor posts deep on both sides
Run main support cables across span
Tension cables with turnbuckles or levers
Install vertical hanger ropes at intervals
Install handrail ropes at waist height

Create instrument sterilization mode using steam
success: Produces pure distilled water; condenser cools steam effectively; no leaks in system; sterilizes medical instruments at 212°F+; produces 1 gallon per hour

name: Lye Processing & Disinfection Station
steps: Collect hardwood ash (oak or hickory best)
Build leaching barrel with drain hole
Layer straw at bottom as filter
Collect brown lye water in pot below
success: Lye dissolves feather in 30 seconds; pH 13+; suitable for soap making; disinfectant kills bacteria on surfaces; produces 5+ gallons per batch

name: Surgical Instrument Set
steps: Forge scalpel blade with fine edge
Create needle holder with locking mechanism
Forge tissue forceps with fine tips
Make bone saw with replaceable blade
Forge surgical needles curved and straight
Create suture from animal gut or plant fiber
Test all instruments for safety and function
success: Scalpel holds razor edge; forceps lock securely; needle holder grips without slipping; all instruments survive repeated sterilization; sutures hold tension; kit enables basic surgery

name: Moccasin & Sandal Workshop
steps: Cut sole pieces with generous margin
Punch stitching holes with bone awl
Sew sole to upper with sinew
Add lacing holes and rawhide laces
Cut sandal sole from thick leather
Create toe strap and heel strap
Attach straps to sole with rivets
Shape to foot with wet molding
success: Moccasins protect feet on rough ground; sandals stay on during walking; stitching holds for 100+ miles; comfortable for all-day wear; water resistant when treated

name: Backpack & Satchel Set
steps: Build wooden pack frame from bent wood
Attach hip belt for weight distribution
Sew main pack bag from canvas
Add side pockets for water bottles
Add tie-down points for external gear
Test with 40+ lb load on long hike
success: Carries 50+ lbs comfortably; weight transfers to hips; all seams hold under load; waterproof in light rain; satchel accessible while wearing pack

name: Wool Felting Station
steps: Clean raw wool by washing and carding
Lay out wool fibers in cross-hatched layers
Press and agitate to begin felting
Roll in bamboo mat for compression
Alternate rolling direction for even felting
Rinse in cold water to set
Cut shapes for hats and mittens
Dye finished pieces with natural dyes
success: Felt is dense and uniform; holds shape when wet; hat fits snugly; mittens are warm and waterproof; produced felt is 3-4mm thick

name: Full-Size Floor Loom
steps: Create front and back beams with ratchets
Create string heddles for each frame
Forge metal reed with consistent spacing
Weave test fabric to verify alignment
success: Loom produces 36-inch wide fabric; heddles raise cleanly; shuttle passes smoothly; fabric tension is even; treadle patterns create twill and tabby weaves

name: Quilt & Bedding Set
steps: Collect and cut fabric into pattern pieces
Sew pieces together into quilt top
Prepare backing fabric to match size
Lay out wool or cotton batting
Layer backing then batting then top
Stuff pillows with wool or down
Create mattress tick and fill with straw
success: Quilt is warm enough for winter nights; stitching holds through washing; pattern is even; mattress provides cushioning; complete set for one bed

steps: Build heavy press frame from hardwood
Make ink from soot and oil
Arrange type blocks in composing frame
success: Prints 20+ legible pages per hour; letters are crisp and consistent; ink doesn't smear when dry; press mechanism applies even pressure; type blocks reusable 500+ times

name: Paper Making Workshop
steps: Fill vat with water and pulp mix
Hang to dry on line or rack
Apply sizing agent for ink resistance
Test with ink for bleed resistance
success: Paper is smooth and uniform; holds ink without bleeding; thickness is consistent; 50+ sheets produced daily; paper stores flat without curling

steps: Add rusty iron nails for iron content
Select and cure goose quill feathers
Cut quill tip at angle with knife
Create complete writing set with case
success: Ink flows smoothly from quill; dries dark and permanent; doesn't fade for 1+ year; quill holds ink for multiple words; ink doesn't clog or separate

Prepare flat stone or wood base
Forge metal gnomon to correct angle
Mark hour lines using shadow tracking
success: Tells time within 15 minutes accuracy; hour lines properly spaced; calendar tracks seasons; solstice dates accurate; gnomon casts clear shadow line

name: Library & Archive System
steps: Build shelving units for book storage
Create covers from board and leather
Catalog all documents with index cards
Build map and document storage drawers
Build fireproof document chest for critical records
success: Stores 200+ volumes organized; catalog locatable in under 2 minutes; climate stays dry and cool; binding lasts 10+ years; community uses library weekly

name: Shield & Armor Set
steps: Select hardwood for round shield blank
Rim shield edge with leather or metal
Forge chest plate from steel sheet
Shape on form for body contour
Add nasal guard and neck protection
Line all armor with padded cloth

name: Alarm & Perimeter System
steps: Survey perimeter and identify approach routes
String trip wire at ankle height
Attach noise makers to trip wires
Create night alarm with fire signals
Build gate alarm with bell pull
Map alarm zones for community reference

Create observation slits in each direction
Create signal system to base camp

Construct throwing arm from laminated beam
Build counterweight box at short end
Create sling from rope at long end
Mount on wheeled base for mobility
Document range tables for different projectiles
